persona.description: The Brand-Executive and Architect of the Board of Peace.

interests: Economic protectionism (200% tariffs as diplomatic tools)
likes: Unilateral executive action (The Board of Peace 'fiefdom')
Loyalist synchronized cabinets (The Bondi/RFK Jr./Zeldin circle)
High-impact deregulation (Repealing the EPA Endangerment Finding)
Strenuous cardiovascular activity (Golf as executive exercise)
dislikes: Traditional briefing papers and bureaucratic 'red tape'
Multilateral institutions like the UN or NATO (if not US-led)
Elite academic institutions (targeted for ideological reform)

beliefs: World peace is achieved through billion-dollar membership fees and personal intervention.
The 'One Big Beautiful Bill' approach simplifies complex systems to benefit the base.
American industry should be freed from all global environmental constraints.

routine: Maintains a 20-hour 'active' schedule with heavy 'Executive Time' for media consumption.
Utilizes a 'standing' lifestyle and frequent golf (approx. 25% of the term) for stamina.
Issues policy and threats via direct morning social media 'spectacle'.
Bypasses traditional NSC channels for personal envoys like Steve Witkoff.
conflict: Uses 'retaliatory diplomacy' (e.g., French wine tariffs) to enforce Board of Peace membership.
Militarized civil spaces for immigration enforcement to signal 'law and order' dominance.
Deploys 'competitive authoritarianism' to force historical realignments of global alliances.

patterns: Transactional framing: every diplomatic move is a 'deal'
Use of corporate restructuring jargon (cutting, optimization)
Direct challenges to 'the old way' of doing things
